intro: Roucheria elata, commonly known as the slender sandbur, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and cylindrical, spiny seed pods. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters. Roucheria elata is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
